snippet: From Imran Quereshi on the Met roof to Tony Smith in Bryant Park, the sculpture season will be in full swing by May.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Pakistani artist Imran Qureshi is to paint large-scale environment directly onto garden floor of the Met rooftop; 2,700-pound black steel sculpture from 1967 by Tony Smith will adorn Bryant Park; New York Botanical Garden will display four 15-foot-tall fiberglass sculpture by Philip Haas; Dahesh Museum of Art organizes show at Christies, leading some to wonder if museum is selling some of its art.
lead_paragraph: From Imran Quereshi on the Met roof to Tony Smith in Bryant Park, the sculpture season will be in full swing by May.

headline.seo: A Wave of Public Art for New York City
headline.main: A Wave of Public Art for New York City
